intro: Hieracium marchesonii, commonly known as Marcheson's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the British Isles. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. It is an herbaceous perennial that blooms from June to August.
